series.title: Victory At Sea
series.shortDescription: Winning a 1954 Emmy Award, this World War Two documentary series was originally broadcast by NBC starting six years after the end of the war. The series was syndicated to local stations and commercially successful through the middle 1960s.
series.longDescription: Winning a 1954 Emmy Award, this World War Two documentary series was originally broadcast by NBC starting six years after the end of the war. The series was syndicated to local stations and commercially successful through the middle 1960s.

episodes.title: Design For Peace
episodes.shortDescription: Surrender of Japan and aftermath of war: The atomic bomb is detonated, and its effects demonstrated at Hiroshima and Nagasaki. Japan surrenders, signing the surrender documents aboard the USS Missouri. The US armed forces come home to signs saying, "Welcome Home" before they are greeted by mothers, wives, children and…
episodes.longDescription: Surrender of Japan and aftermath of war: The atomic bomb is detonated, and its effects demonstrated at Hiroshima and Nagasaki. Japan surrenders, signing the surrender documents aboard the USS Missouri. The US armed forces come home to signs saying, "Welcome Home" before they are greeted by mothers, wives, children and fellow neighbors.

episodes.title: Suicide For Glory
episodes.shortDescription: Okinawa: In a last effort at glory, Japan employs suicide pilots—the Kamikaze—who crash their planes into ships in order to destroy the American spirit. But the US Navy and Marines are ready for them with their guns, and they fought heroically against the onslaught. And on Okinawa, Americans fight a…
episodes.longDescription: Okinawa: In a last effort at glory, Japan employs suicide pilots—the Kamikaze—who crash their planes into ships in order to destroy the American spirit. But the US Navy and Marines are ready for them with their guns, and they fought heroically against the onslaught. And on Okinawa, Americans fight a major battle with the Japanese Army.

episodes.title: The Road To Mandalay
episodes.shortDescription: China, Burma, India, and Indian Ocean: The Japanese invade China in 1936, but the Japanese are not satisfied and they invade Indochina and Thailand, enabling the invasion of Burma. The US and British navies nurture their relations with the Indian Navy as supplies are built for the return. Eventually, it…
episodes.longDescription: China, Burma, India, and Indian Ocean: The Japanese invade China in 1936, but the Japanese are not satisfied and they invade Indochina and Thailand, enabling the invasion of Burma. The US and British navies nurture their relations with the Indian Navy as supplies are built for the return. Eventually, it was decided to build a road to link with the Burma Road. Eventually, they "came back to Mandalay", and the first supplies traveled the road to cheering Chinese.

episodes.title: Target Suribachi
episodes.shortDescription: Iwo Jima: The US fought two battles here—the US Marines at Iwo Jima against the Japanese, and the US Navy against a typhoon. During the now-legendary events depicted in this episode, the series reaches the final throes of battle in the Pacific war against the Japanese. And as the scene…
episodes.longDescription: Iwo Jima: The US fought two battles here—the US Marines at Iwo Jima against the Japanese, and the US Navy against a typhoon. During the now-legendary events depicted in this episode, the series reaches the final throes of battle in the Pacific war against the Japanese. And as the scene of the recent Mount Suribachi memorial appears, viewers are once again reminded of the price that comes before true victory can be achieved.

episodes.title: The Fate of Europe
episodes.shortDescription: Black Sea, south of France, surrender: Sevastopol was liberated and the Allies defeat Germany. The meeting of Roosevelt, Churchill and Stalin for final plans for Germany's surrender and the forming of the United Nations are depicted. At the end, Hitler commits suicide, and Nazi flags are torn apart and German…
episodes.longDescription: Black Sea, south of France, surrender: Sevastopol was liberated and the Allies defeat Germany. The meeting of Roosevelt, Churchill and Stalin for final plans for Germany's surrender and the forming of the United Nations are depicted. At the end, Hitler commits suicide, and Nazi flags are torn apart and German military uniforms and hats lie on the ground, discarded.

episodes.title: Full Fathom Five
episodes.shortDescription: US submarines, 1941–1945: This episode shows how US Navy submarines contributed to the Japanese empire's defeat, sinking thousands of tons of cargo ships.
episodes.longDescription: US submarines, 1941–1945: This episode shows how US Navy submarines contributed to the Japanese empire's defeat, sinking thousands of tons of cargo ships.

episodes.title: Return of the Allies
episodes.shortDescription: Liberation of the Philippines: The Japanese fleet is disintegrating, and the Imperial Navy conducts its last major operation in the Philippines. It ends in debacle: The risen battleships of Pearl Harbor avenge the attack in Surigao Strait, the Center Force is defeated in Sibuyan Sea, the jeep carriers and destroyers…
episodes.longDescription: Liberation of the Philippines: The Japanese fleet is disintegrating, and the Imperial Navy conducts its last major operation in the Philippines. It ends in debacle: The risen battleships of Pearl Harbor avenge the attack in Surigao Strait, the Center Force is defeated in Sibuyan Sea, the jeep carriers and destroyers fend off a stronger Japanese force near Samar and the remaining Japanese aircraft carriers are sunk. This segment marked the near inevitability that the Japanese would accept defeat and surrender to the Allies.

episodes.title: The Battle For Leyte Gulf
episodes.shortDescription: The Japanese fleet is disintegrating, and the Imperial Navy conducts its last major operation in the Philippines. It ends in debacle: The risen battleships of Pearl Harbor avenge the attack in Surigao Strait, the Center Force is defeated in Sibuyan Sea, the jeep carriers and destroyers fend off a stronger…
episodes.longDescription: The Japanese fleet is disintegrating, and the Imperial Navy conducts its last major operation in the Philippines. It ends in debacle: The risen battleships of Pearl Harbor avenge the attack in Surigao Strait, the Center Force is defeated in Sibuyan Sea, the jeep carriers and destroyers fend off a stronger Japanese force near Samar and the remaining Japanese aircraft carriers are sunk. This segment marked the near inevitability that the Japanese would accept defeat and surrender to the Allies.

episodes.title: Two If By Sea
episodes.shortDescription: Peleliu and Angaur: Before the Philippine Islands, the US first attacks Peleliu and Anguar.
episodes.longDescription: Peleliu and Angaur: Before the Philippine Islands, the US first attacks Peleliu and Anguar.

episodes.title: The Turkey Shoot
episodes.shortDescription: Conquest of the Marianas: Guam, a US territory, is invaded by Japanese a few days after Pearl Harbor and remains occupied for two and a half years. The Japanese fleet is destroyed in a classic "turkey shoot". Meanwhile, the Americans are preparing the bases in the Marianas for the ultimate…
episodes.longDescription: Conquest of the Marianas: Guam, a US territory, is invaded by Japanese a few days after Pearl Harbor and remains occupied for two and a half years. The Japanese fleet is destroyed in a classic "turkey shoot". Meanwhile, the Americans are preparing the bases in the Marianas for the ultimate bomber offensive against Japan.

episodes.title: The Killers and the Killed
episodes.shortDescription: Victory in the Atlantic, 1943–1945: The U-Boats are ascendant, and their triumphs proclaimed in Germany. But the Allies fight back with new bases in countries bordering the Atlantic Ocean, new anti-submarine techniques and the new escort, or "jeep", carrier. Thus, the eventual neutralization and destruction of the German U-Boat forces…
episodes.longDescription: Victory in the Atlantic, 1943–1945: The U-Boats are ascendant, and their triumphs proclaimed in Germany. But the Allies fight back with new bases in countries bordering the Atlantic Ocean, new anti-submarine techniques and the new escort, or "jeep", carrier. Thus, the eventual neutralization and destruction of the German U-Boat forces is guaranteed.

episodes.title: D-Day
episodes.shortDescription: Normandy: The Allied invasion of Normandy is detailed—from preparation to execution—via vintage footage from both sides.
episodes.longDescription: Normandy: The Allied invasion of Normandy is detailed—from preparation to execution—via vintage footage from both sides.

episodes.title: Roman Renaissance
episodes.shortDescription: Sicily and the Italian campaign: While Hitler's Germany begins its decline, Mussolini's Italy falls. Eventually, as Naples and Rome are bombed, the Italians surrender. But there is still a slow campaign (Salerno, Cassino, Anzio) until victory is achieved by the liberation of Roma, where Romans celebrate freedom waving American flags,…
episodes.longDescription: Sicily and the Italian campaign: While Hitler's Germany begins its decline, Mussolini's Italy falls. Eventually, as Naples and Rome are bombed, the Italians surrender. But there is still a slow campaign (Salerno, Cassino, Anzio) until victory is achieved by the liberation of Roma, where Romans celebrate freedom waving American flags, and the Pope addressing the audience.

episodes.title: Melanesian Nightmare
episodes.shortDescription: New Guinea Campaign: The Allies are victorious in New Guinea as they repel the Japanese. They thus bring the fight through a series of "island-hopping" offensives using a new ship—the slow but vital LST. The price paid is great on both sides, but as Japanese casualties increase in their never-ending…
episodes.longDescription: New Guinea Campaign: The Allies are victorious in New Guinea as they repel the Japanese. They thus bring the fight through a series of "island-hopping" offensives using a new ship—the slow but vital LST. The price paid is great on both sides, but as Japanese casualties increase in their never-ending losing battle against the Allied onslaught, their homeland only hears news of their victory being broadcast by radio. Japan's people are shown suffering in defeat through a scene of a massive funeral, providing a balance of how universal grief truly is.

episodes.title: Conquest of Micronesia
episodes.shortDescription: Carrier warfare and the Gilberts and Marshalls: The aircraft carriers of the US Navy attack in the Central Pacific Ocean at the Gilbert and Marshall Islands, destroying Japanese installations. But for all of these, there is a price to pay for victory.
episodes.longDescription: Carrier warfare and the Gilberts and Marshalls: The aircraft carriers of the US Navy attack in the Central Pacific Ocean at the Gilbert and Marshall Islands, destroying Japanese installations. But for all of these, there is a price to pay for victory.

episodes.title: Magnetic North
episodes.shortDescription: War from Murmansk to Alaska: This episode of Victory at Sea explores the battles between the Allies and Germans near the Arctic Circle, and the convoys battling past German-occupied Norway to Russia. Meanwhile, the Japanese invade Alaska unsuccessfully, and the US Navy again is ordered to guard this vital area…
episodes.longDescription: War from Murmansk to Alaska: This episode of Victory at Sea explores the battles between the Allies and Germans near the Arctic Circle, and the convoys battling past German-occupied Norway to Russia. Meanwhile, the Japanese invade Alaska unsuccessfully, and the US Navy again is ordered to guard this vital area amidst the harsh climate and vast vistas.

episodes.title: Beneath The Southern Cross
episodes.shortDescription: War in the South Atlantic: The South Atlantic becomes a front in the overall Battle of the Atlantic, from the pursuit of the German ship Graf Spee to the battle between HMS Devonshire and the German raider Atlantis. The Allies, meanwhile, nurture their relations with South America and gain a…
episodes.longDescription: War in the South Atlantic: The South Atlantic becomes a front in the overall Battle of the Atlantic, from the pursuit of the German ship Graf Spee to the battle between HMS Devonshire and the German raider Atlantis. The Allies, meanwhile, nurture their relations with South America and gain a vital base in Ascension Island. Despite sympathy for the Nazis, South American nations rally to the Allies' cause, securing vital bases, forces and resources.

episodes.title: Sea and Sand
episodes.shortDescription: Invasion of North Africa: The USSR government demands a "second front" as their country struggles against the Germans. The wish is granted as Roosevelt and Churchill in Washington agree on the first invasion of North Africa against General Rommel's forces via Operation Torch, while the Allies also neutralize many of…
episodes.longDescription: Invasion of North Africa: The USSR government demands a "second front" as their country struggles against the Germans. The wish is granted as Roosevelt and Churchill in Washington agree on the first invasion of North Africa against General Rommel's forces via Operation Torch, while the Allies also neutralize many of the Axis' Mediterranean supply bases. Eventually, the Germans counterattack, but to no avail.

episodes.title: Mare Nostrum
episodes.shortDescription: Mediterranean Theater, 1940–1942: Benito Mussolini uses 'mare nostrum' which means 'our sea.' Italy's enters into the war with Germany. Britain provides military aid to Greece to help them against the fascists.
episodes.longDescription: Mediterranean Theater, 1940–1942: Benito Mussolini uses 'mare nostrum' which means 'our sea.' Italy's enters into the war with Germany. Britain provides military aid to Greece to help them against the fascists.

episodes.title: Rings Around Rabaul
episodes.shortDescription: Struggle For Solomon Islands: This episode refers to the US strategy of surrounding and strangling the main Japanese base on Rabaul in the New Britain Islands in the autumn of 1943 through invasions of its surrounding islands. The "Seabees" make the airfields operational quickly, radar and observation planes prove a…
episodes.longDescription: Struggle For Solomon Islands: This episode refers to the US strategy of surrounding and strangling the main Japanese base on Rabaul in the New Britain Islands in the autumn of 1943 through invasions of its surrounding islands. The "Seabees" make the airfields operational quickly, radar and observation planes prove a key US edge.

episodes.title: Guadalcanal
episodes.shortDescription: Guadalcanal: After training in Australia and New Zealand, the US Marines land on Guadalcanal. The US Navy suffers defeats by the Japanese Navy around the island—in an area called Ironbottom Sound. Meanwhile, to the tune of Richard Rodgers' most famous march from the series, America's men and material are mobilized…
episodes.longDescription: Guadalcanal: After training in Australia and New Zealand, the US Marines land on Guadalcanal. The US Navy suffers defeats by the Japanese Navy around the island—in an area called Ironbottom Sound. Meanwhile, to the tune of Richard Rodgers' most famous march from the series, America's men and material are mobilized against the ultimate struggle that is World War II.

episodes.title: Mediterranean Mosaic
episodes.shortDescription: Gibraltar and Malta: World War II comes to the Mediterranean Sea as Italian, French and British naval forces struggle. British forces have the unenviable position of guarding the sea as they escort convoys from Gibraltar to Malta. Meanwhile, the German Luftwaffe attacks Malta, but the Maltese remain determined to keep…
episodes.longDescription: Gibraltar and Malta: World War II comes to the Mediterranean Sea as Italian, French and British naval forces struggle. British forces have the unenviable position of guarding the sea as they escort convoys from Gibraltar to Malta. Meanwhile, the German Luftwaffe attacks Malta, but the Maltese remain determined to keep fighting.

episodes.title: Midway Is East
episodes.shortDescription: Japanese victories and the Battle of Midway: The Japanese are ascendant as they invade the East Indies, Singapore and the Philippines. But the Americans are victorious, first on the Coral Sea and ultimately on Midway as they manage to bomb and sink four of Japan's aircraft carriers—the same ones that…
episodes.longDescription: Japanese victories and the Battle of Midway: The Japanese are ascendant as they invade the East Indies, Singapore and the Philippines. But the Americans are victorious, first on the Coral Sea and ultimately on Midway as they manage to bomb and sink four of Japan's aircraft carriers—the same ones that were used for the attack on Pearl Harbor—making the imperial fleet retreat and giving the US an early victory in the Pacific.

episodes.title: Sealing The Breech
episodes.shortDescription: Anti-submarine warfare: With war now declared by the US, naval forces join to bring convoys of supplies across the Atlantic Ocean to the Allies in England. German U-Boats come through and manage to destroy some of ships along the way. Still, the Americans are resilient.
episodes.longDescription: Anti-submarine warfare: With war now declared by the US, naval forces join to bring convoys of supplies across the Atlantic Ocean to the Allies in England. German U-Boats come through and manage to destroy some of ships along the way. Still, the Americans are resilient.

episodes.title: The Pacific Boils Over
episodes.shortDescription: Using Japanese footage, viewers see the planning, execution and, ultimately, the celebration of the country's attack on Pearl Harbor. There also is an explanation provided for the attack and some peaceful moments depicted among the US sailors before the attack. Though damaged, the US Navy survives to fight again.
episodes.longDescription: Using Japanese footage, viewers see the planning, execution and, ultimately, the celebration of the country's attack on Pearl Harbor. There also is an explanation provided for the attack and some peaceful moments depicted among the US sailors before the attack. Though damaged, the US Navy survives to fight again.

episodes.title: Design For War
episodes.shortDescription: World War II begins with the Germans invading Poland and France. But German forces are restrained by the British thanks to the vital convoys, Canadian and American naval forces' initial involvement and the Lend-Lease program. Still, the German submarine war increases its crescendo thanks to new French bases.
episodes.longDescription: World War II begins with the Germans invading Poland and France. But German forces are restrained by the British thanks to the vital convoys, Canadian and American naval forces' initial involvement and the Lend-Lease program. Still, the German submarine war increases its crescendo thanks to new French bases.

tvSpecials.title: The Hangman
tvSpecials.shortDescription: Steve Goldman writes of this powerful short movie: "Les Goldman was my father. Creating this film was one of the most important accomplishments of his life. He was inspired to make this film after hearing the poem 'Hangman' read on Pacifica Radio in Los Angeles by Les Claypool. My father…
tvSpecials.longDescription: Steve Goldman writes of this powerful short movie: "Les Goldman was my father. Creating this film was one of the most important accomplishments of his life. He was inspired to make this film after hearing the poem 'Hangman' read on Pacifica Radio in Los Angeles by Les Claypool. My father almost single-handedly raised the money to make the film, with $100 and $200 donations from friends and associates. Paul Julian, Serge Hovey, and Herschel Bernardi were friends and colleagues of my father. He elicited their help in making the film. Though the poem on which the film is based has Holocaust parallels, the poet, Maurice Ogden, was actually writing about America during the McCarthy era."
